Title: The Hunger Games
Author: Suzanne Collins
Description: A dystopian novel where a young girl participates in a deadly televised competition.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A classic novel about the American Dream and the tragic life of Jay Gatsby in the 1920s

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South during the 1930s.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime that exercises extreme control over its citizens.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A romantic novel that explores the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: The first book in the series where a young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts .

Title: The Catcher in the Rye  The Hobbit
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A novel about teenage rebellion and alienation, narrated by the disaffected Holden Caulfield.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A fantasy adventure where Bilbo Baggins embarks on a quest to help dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A romantic novel that explores the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.
